    All Classes and Interfaces

    Class
    Description
    AddBooking
    A command that creates (issues) a new Booking, potentially specifying seat type and food option.
    AddCustomer
    A command that creates a new Customer record in the system.
    AddCustomerWindow
    A GUI window that allows a user to create a new Customer record by entering the customer's name, phone, and email.
    AddFlight
    A command to create a new Flight with separate seat capacities (economy, business, first) plus a base price.
    AddFlightWindow
    A window that collects data for adding a new Flight with multiple seat capacities (economy, business, first) plus a base price.
    AdminReportsWindow
    A simple report window that shows total flights, customers, bookings, total revenue, and the most booked flight.
    Booking
    Represents a booking made by a customer for a specific flight.
    BookingDataManager
    Manages loading and storing booking data to/from a text file, including seat type, food option, and any fees or dynamic pricing.
    CancelBooking
    A command that cancels an existing booking.
    CancelBookingWindow
    A GUI window that allows a user to cancel an existing booking by specifying the customer and flight IDs.
    Command
    Represents an executable command that operates on the FlightBookingSystem.
    CommandParser
    The CommandParser class processes user input (in textual form) and returns the corresponding Command object for execution.
    Customer
    Represents a customer in the booking system.
    CustomerDataManager
    Manages loading and storing customer data to/from a text file.
    CustomerTest
    Tests for the Customer class, focusing on email property and basic constructor usage.
    DataManager
    A generic interface for loading and storing data related to the FlightBookingSystem.
    DeleteCustomer
    A command that marks a Customer as deleted so they are excluded from listings.
    DeleteFlight
    A command that marks a Flight as deleted so it no longer appears in flight listings, implementing a soft-delete strategy.
    EditBooking
    A command to update an existing booking to a new flight, with an option to change seat type.
    Flight
    Represents a flight in the booking system, with seat capacities for multiple seat types.
    FlightBookingSystem
    The core Flight Booking System, managing flights, customers, and bookings.
    FlightBookingSystemData
    Manages loading and storing the entire FlightBookingSystem by delegating to various DataManager implementations (e.g.
    FlightBookingSystemData.Snapshot
    A simple container class for storing lists of flights and customers at a given moment in time (for rollback or backup).
    FlightBookingSystemException
    FlightBookingSystemException is a custom exception used to indicate errors or invalid operations within the flight booking system, such as failed data storage or invalid booking actions.
    FlightBookingSystemTest
    Tests adding flights/customers to the FlightBookingSystem.
    FlightDataManager
    Manages loading and storing flight data to/from a text file.
    FlightTest
    Tests for Flight class that uses separate seat capacities (econCap, bizCap, firstCap) and a base price.
    FoodOption
    An enumeration representing different food options customers can choose for a flight booking.
    Help
    A command that prints the static help message defined in Command.HELP_MESSAGE.
    IssueBookingWindow
    A window that lets a user issue a new booking by specifying a customer ID, flight ID, seat class, and food option.
    ListAllCustomersWindow
    A window that displays a table of all non-deleted customers (ID, Name, Phone, Email, Booking count).
    ListBookings
    A command that lists all bookings in the system.
    ListBookingsCustomer
    A command that lists all bookings for a specific customer, identified by their customer ID.
    ListBookingsDate
    A command that lists all bookings made on a specific date.
    ListBookingsFlight
    A command that lists all bookings for a specific flight, identified by flightId.
    ListCustomers
    A command that lists all active (non-deleted) customers in the system.
    ListFlights
    A command that lists all active (non-deleted) flights in the system.
    ListPassengersWindow
    A window that displays all passengers (customers) assigned to a specific Flight.
    LoadGUI
    A command that launches the GUI version of the Flight Booking System by creating a new MainWindow.
    Main
    The entry point of the Flight Booking System console application.
    MainWindow
    The main GUI window for the Flight Booking Management System.
    NoOpCommand
    A no-operation (NoOp) command, typically used for commands like 'help' that only print information and do not modify the system.
    SearchFlightsWindow
    A window that allows users to search for flights based on optional origin, destination, and a date range.
    SeatType
    An enumeration of seat classes for flights, defining Economy, Business, or First class.
    ShowBookingsWindow
    A window that can display either all system bookings or all bookings for a single customer, depending on which constructor is called.
    ShowCustomer
    A command that displays detailed information about a single customer, identified by customerId, including a list of their bookings.
    ShowFlight
    A command that displays details about a specific flight, including seat capacities, base price, deletion status, and passenger list.
    UpdateBookingWindow
    A window that allows updating a booking to a new flight, optionally changing the seat type.
